result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A. Hartung was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Total court costs due during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.
No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.
Random testing.
Maintain employment of 24 hrs per week minimum or attend school full-time.
Pay supervision fees.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew A. Hartung in court with attorney Mark A. Langholz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Defendant entered guilty plea to the amended information. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence.
Letter from Law Offices of Levy and Levy confirming that Further Proceedings have been rescheduled from 04/28/2015 to 05/04/2015 at 1:15 pm.
Atty. Langholz requests short adjournment. Case rescheduled to 5/4/2015 at 1:15 pm. Confirming letter to be sent by Atty. Langholz.
Further proceedings on April 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Mark A. Langholz in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Langholz states defendant is attending counseling.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on March 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Matthew A. Hartung in court with attorney Mark A. Langholz.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds matter over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading of information and enters plea of not guilty. Further proceedings scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 11:00 am. Bail will continue.
Status hearing on January 22, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Mark A. Langholz in court.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Langholz has been in contact with the defendant previously, not sure why defendant is not here. Court orders bench warrant but stays until next court date.  Status hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for public defender representation and counsel will be appointed.  State requesting $500 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $1000 signature bond  w/conditions:  no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; no alcohol.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Court orders matter adj to 1/14 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
